statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Ervin Mitchell scored 17 points and Nigel Ribeiro added 16 as Grambling State defeated NAIA-member Jarvis Christian 80-58 Wednesday night.
article.headline: Mitchell leads Grambling State past Jarvis Christian 80-58
article.linkText: Mitchell leads Grambling State past Jarvis Christian 80-58
article.story: GRAMBLING, La. -- Ervin Mitchell scored 17 points and Nigel Ribeiro added 16 as Grambling State defeated NAIA-member Jarvis Christian 80-58 Wednesday night. Mitchell, Carlton Lowe and Mark Gray jumpstarted Grambling (5-9) on offense. Gray's 3-pointer put the Tigers up 19-9. Grambling pushed the lead to 14 points and Grambling took a 43-25 lead at intermission. Jarvis Christian cut the lead to six before the Tigers put the game away and raced to a 27-point lead with three minutes left in the game. Deonte Hearns finished with 14 points, shooting 7 for 11 from the field and snaring 13 rebounds. Lowe finished with 13 points. Grambling shot 51.7 percent from the field to 30 percent for the Bulldogs. Chris Key finished with 15 points and nine boards, and Dion Malone scored 13 for Jarvis Christian (1-10). The game was a matchup rescheduled from Dec. 5.
